stories.text:
It happens often that I find an interesting thread, read all the comments and keep it open in a tab for the next few hours so I can refresh and read new comments as they come in. The problem with this is that you never know where these new comments are, so you usually have to re-read lots of stuff before finding the new comments you're looking for.

I'm just wondering how other people deal with this and how do they track new comments to interesting submissions.
stories.title: Ask HN: Following a Hacker News thread for new comments

stories.text:
I am debating myself about: 
Who wants to hear me versus who wants to read what I write? 
Any value addition in the process? 
Is discovery of podcast dependent on the algorithms? 
Is it the new gold-rush for attention starved people? 
Is adding voice going to be data-extractive? 
Your thoughts please.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there any value in having your own podcast “show”?
Dance Language of the Honey Bee
Those Who Support Internet Censorship Lack Psychological Maturity
If American democracy is going to survive, media must make this crucial shift
Step Aside Unicorns, 2021 Was the Year of the Decacorn
